article_1.name: American submarine discovered off Ocean City coast
article_1.summary: The wreckage of an early U.S. Navy submarine, sunk while being used for target practice by bombers in 1936, has likely been discovered off the coast of Ocean City by a company that salvages shipwrecks.

article_2.name: Salvage Firm Says it Found Old Submarine off Delmarva Peninsula
article_2.summary: OCEAN CITY, Md. (AP)- A salvage company says that it has likely discovered the wreckage of a century-old submarine off the coast of Maryland.

article_3.name: Top Story -- World War I-era American submarine discovered on ocean floor off Cape May
article_3.summary: CAPE MAY — With war looming on the horizon, and a new generation of German U-boats under construction, the United States military faced an urgent problem: how to sink a boat that’s already underwater?

article_4.name: Titanic sister ship secret revealed by Millstone deep-sea adventurers
article_4.summary: MILLSTONE TOWNSHIP - This is no ordinary living room. Along one wall stands the six-foot-tall helm from the stern of the Ayuruoca, a Brazilian freighter that sank off the Monmouth County coast in 1945. On the opposite wall sits a cabinet with china from the Andrea Doria, the Italian ocean liner that famously crashed into another ship and sank near Massachusetts in 1956.
